info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 3:54AM PST until January 12 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches possible. * WHERE...The Winter Weather Advisory includes portions of the northern Klamath Basin north of Chiloquin. This includes portions of Highway 97. The Winter Storm Watch includes elevations above 4500 feet in the Klamath Basin including Highway 97 near Modoc Point and north Chiloquin and higher portions of highway 140. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 4 PM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
